newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - UAL '96 estimate raised.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - UAL '96 estimate raised.

text.p: -- Gruntal & Co analyst Steven Lewins said Wednesday he raised his 1996 earnings estimate for UAL Corp, parent of United Airlines, to $7.85 per fully distributed share from $7.50.
-- The $7.85 a share estimate includes charges for travel agency litigation settlement and writedowns of airline seats. Excluding those items, Lewins said his 1996 estimate is $8.15.
-- Gruntal's rating on UAL remains outperform.
-- On October 22, UAL reported third quarter earnings of $3.58 per fully distributed share, excluding the travel agency charge and the writedown of older seats.

-- "Including these charges, as seems appropriate, UAL earned $3.29 in the quarter, in line with our $3.25 estimate and below consensus of $3.40 that may or may not have excluded the travel agency charge," Lewin wrote in a report.
-- Looking ahead, Lewins said UAL is optimistic on the fourth quarter. Bookings look good and load factor probably will rise.
